author: foflexity
content:
I'm trying to understand the proper ways to use engine_ methods from the perspective of the consensus client, hopefully this is the right channel to ask in, please let me know if there's a better place.

When using the engine api, calling new payload with an array of execution payloads... should I be able to pass a batch of say 10 blocks in order (tried asc and desc order), then call fork choice updated with the hash of the highest block from that batch and expect the chain to advance?

I assumed this was why new payload accepts an array... but it seems to only advance when I pass arrays with a single execution payload in them.  Passing 2 or more execution payloads leaves the execution client in a syncing state however the same code with a batch size of 1 execution payload does move the chain forward.
